title: What to expect from TEAS test?
Description: The TEAS exam comprises 170 multiple-choice questions, which are structured to test your knowledge. This exam tests mathematics, reading, science, and English and language usage. Once you complete college, you ought to prepare for these questions. They are essential for aspiring nurses, but if time is tight, we have services to help them pass this test.

title: How long will my TEAS score remain valid?
Description: Usually, your TEAS score will remain valid for two years. This means you need to enroll in a nursing program within 24 months after passing your exam. Plan ahead to stay on track for your nursing career.

title: How long does a TEAS test take?
Description: You are required to complete all 170 questions in 209 minutes. While it might seem like a short time, with proper preparation and our resources, you can complete the test and cross-check your answers to aim for a 90+ score.

title: What does a TEAS score entail?
Description: A TEAS score represents your overall performance in four sections: Mathematics, Science, Reading, and English & Language Usage. While the score to qualify for nursing school may vary between schools, the composite score is about 70%. To be on the safe side, we aim for 90% and above, which you can achieve with our help.

title: Can I pay after getting my TEAS results?
Description: Absolutely. We believe in building trust and long-term relationships with our clients. We offer flexible payment plans, allowing you to make an initial partial payment or pay the full amount after receiving your score. Our goal is to provide genuine support and create a reliable partnership.

title: What types of questions will I encounter on the TEAS exam?
Description: The TEAS exam comprises 170 questions, with 53 testing on reading key ideas and knowledge integration, 36 on mathematics, algebra, data, and measurement, 53 on science, human anatomy, life and physical science, physiology, and scientific reasoning, and 28 on English and language usage, focusing on conventions of standard English and vocabulary.

title: Are calculators allowed in TEAS exams?
Description: Yes. However, personal calculators are not allowed. For remote/online tests, a digital calculator will be provided, making it easy to handle calculations.

title: Can I go back and revisit questions while taking the TEAS exam?
Description: Absolutely. You can revisit completed or skipped questions within the same section of the exam. For example, if you're in the reading section, you can go back to any reading question, but once you move to science, you can't revisit reading questions.
